Reviews.Title: “Good Port in a Storm”
Reviews.Author: Steve1362
Reviews.Content: I got stranded in Chi due to a flight cancellation and was desperate to find a hotel that would not break the bank. Four Points is not one of the names I usually trust for a quality stay but since it was the only hotel with a vacancy that would not cost an arm and a leg, I decided to take a chance. I was pleasantly surprised. While the hotel shows some wear, the staff was very friendly, greatly appreciated after the stress of being stranded, I had a decent meal at the adjoining restaurant for a good price, a good night’s sleep, the best complimentary breakfast that I have had in a long time and a friendly van driver getting me to the airport in the morning with plenty of time to catch my new flight.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: tomval
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times when I have a very early flight to catch out of Midway. Hotel is convenient and has free parking. For the price, the hotel is adequate. It could use some updating but the staff is accomodating, price is right and it is quiet and convenient. It is now a Clarion property. Perhaps they will upgrade it.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I would expect from a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Kara B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel one night before flying out early from Midway. Thank goodness we didn't have to stay any longer. The hotel was filthy. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Go here vs more expensive midway hotels”
Reviews.Author: ILuvVacationing
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Chicago for 3 because of hurricane Irene wouldn't allow us to fly back to the Eastcoast from Arizona. Our choices were Denver or Chicago so we picked Chicago. This was an unexpected/extended trip so we didn't have a hotel or car lined up and not much money left. We started making calls to hotels in the airport using the phones provided down the escalator. Well, the big hotel chains (Hampton Inn, Marriott, Hilton, Holiday Inn) were all $170 - 200 a night. Then we called the Four Points Sheraton because I am a starwood preferred guest and I get points for staying there. We didn't call their first because it didn't say "Midway" and we thought it was further away than the others (but it wasn't). Well, they changed their name to Chicago Midway Airport Hotel (new ownership) and no longer were a part of the point programs. However, their rates were only $119 a night for a room with 2 beds. I KNOW!!! I couldn't believe my ears. And, they would come & get us for free and they offered a free shuttle to the subway & airport every half hour. Since we were going to be there for 3 days without a car that was ideal. Although I was thinking that this might be in a bad part of town or crappy rooms but we just couldn't afford to stay in the Marriott. So we took a chance and it was the quality of a Sheraton and not far from the bigger expensive hotels. We are talking 1/4 of a mile from the other hotels on the same street. The rooms were really nice, the restaurant had great food and employees were nice & helpful. We had a small issue with a slow draining tub and they fixed it immediately. Oh & free morning coffee always makes me happy! They have an outdoor pool that was well maintained and I think was heated and a work out room. We walked to Applebees & had dinner and it was great. There's also a hometown Buffet that you can walk to on the same side of the street. There was an Olive Garden across the street & down the road a little but I wasn't comfy crossing 4 lanes of traffic so we skipped Olive Garden. The hotel is right next door to a shopping mall if you needed anything you could walk & get it. What a great deal! Save your money & stay here. Thanks Chicago Midway Airport Hotel for making our unexpected say so great and affordable! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: annabohannon
Reviews.Content: I was so pleased with this hotel. The beds were so comfortable, great location, I felt safe there, I had the best rib-eye steak ever! Everything was clean and the staff was awesome. Seriously, it was a very pleasant ending to a long trip where we had to be at the aiport at 6am.

Reviews.Title: “There's a reason this is no longer a 4Points by Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: motherhen317
Reviews.Content: I booked this motel back in March for a stay in July. On June 20th I received a email that it was no longer a 4points. I was a bit worried about why it had changed. However, I tried to keep an open mind about the situation. I booked the motel for $89/nt when other motels in the area were going for $199/nt. We were only staying 1 night, after the Jimmy Buffett Concert at Toyota Park. After getting the email notification I checked on some other motels in the area and they were all booked up. So, we got there, checked in and headed up to the room. We were on the 4th floor. The carpets in the hall way were very stained and in need of some deep cleaning. The room was relatively clean, but smelled musty. We checked for bed bugs before committing to stay (there were none). There was a thermostat on the wall to control to control the temp. We set it on 72 and it only kicked on 1 time during the night, making it feel very stuffy. Noise from the hallway made it seem like other people were trying to enter our room. The King size bed was comfortable. The shower had very little pressure. When we went to check out the housekeeping lady was sitting in the doorway of another room, talking to another employee. She asked us what room we were checking out of. I found this slightly unprofesional. When we got around the corner to the elevator there was a mop bucket blocking the elevator. Maybe it belonged to the other employee? The area where the motel is located seemed decent. I felt safe, even when returning after 11pm from the concert, and I tend to be paranoid. There was an outdoor (small) pool and a restaurant. We didn't use either, so I can't comment. I probably wouldn't stay here again, unless they undergo a major renovation. The motel is just old and run down. There are plenty of other motels closer to Midway/Toyota Park and they appear much newer. There is also a starbucks located among those motels, for you coffee drinkers. I've stayed at all types of motels/hotels in the past and I would rank this closer to a DaysInn or Motel 6. Not horrible, but not great. And we were really only in the room after the concert to sleep, so it fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed for a Sheraton property. OLD property in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: YepBeenThere
Reviews.Content: For the price and the Sheraton name, i was not impressed. It's an older converted property that needs more updating. Convienient to the airport. Shuttle was slow. Beds were OK, good pillows. OK work area with good chair, but NO plugs nearby. Moderate road noise. bathroom was updated and was decent, had flat screen TV. Noisey AC unit. Overall an OK property, but the Sheraton name calls for higher standards than this and the nightly rate was no bargin.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: ManiBagga
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay. clean with no frills. Okay for an over night stay. nothing fancy at all. just near MDW. Staff was good.

Reviews.Title: “There are worse places to stay”
Reviews.Author: JustJeri
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here during a training session for work. The training event was totally disrupted by other events going on in the hotel at the same time. Please understand that we were holding a education presentation while a very loud worship service/concert was going on in the next room. The front desk staff made it clear to us that it was not their fault. We found a resolution, but without much assistance from staff. The room I stayed in was not well kept. The window would not latch & allowed a cool Chicago breeze to blow in all night. I didn't discover that until I had unpacked my stuff & it was just too much trouble to leave. Dirty carpet. I checked the mattress, it seemed newish, which was a big relief. When I tried to have breakfast delivered, nobody ever answered the phone - I made 2 attempts. If you are needing a place to stay when flying out of Midway, this would work. I think there are better choices that are actually closer to the airport, as well. Unless Sheraton is planning a big renovation, I will find someplace to stay when I need to be in the vicinity of Midway. And if you are looking for training facilities, this is NOT the place.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy!”
Reviews.Author: lgarriso
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we arrived at 2:00 A.M. otherwise we would not have stayed. The minute I would in I was geeted with ( What are you looking for honey). Strange men coming out of the bar area. I was told the bar closed at midnight. The smell immediately was rancid, and dirty smell. It got worse as we went down the hallway to stains, as if someone had been stabbed and the bleeding stain was never cleaned. The whold place was filthy! I tried not to move the whole night long. I had reserved 6 rooms for my family inlcuding young children. The whole experience was a disaster.Some of the tubs in the rooms were actually brown!, and none felt as if they had been cleaned ever! I reserved this hotel because it was part of STARWOODS! The place should be considered a health hazard!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, kind of yucky”
Reviews.Author: cbarcelos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here using hotel points before an early morning flight out of Midway. Overall, I wasn't too pleased, although my partner says I am over-reacting. The hallway rug on our floor was incredibly stained; one or two is one thing, but it looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a looooong time. The room itself was ok, but had that stuffy hotel room stench which would not go away. The air conditioner had leaked water all over the floor; we were too tired to call the front desk to deal with it. For a king bed we had two incredibly flimsy pillows. Overall, eh, very convenient to the airport, but not the sort of place I'd spend money on. WATCH OUT for the red light camera right across the street! The intersection is confusing, and we got a ticket!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to crash near Midway”
Reviews.Author: Glendale_Sarah
Reviews.Content: Well, the title pretty much says it all. This hotel made a great crash pad if you have an early flight out of Midway. It was clean, quiet, and has shuttle service available EARLY in the morning if you have an early flight. I'd definitely stay here again if I was traveling out of Midway.

Reviews.Title: “BASIC BASIC BASIC”
Reviews.Author: MONYLINE
Reviews.Content: Your basic tired hotel with a sheraton shingle. I would rate this hotel as marginally adequate---nothing special about it, so-so help, so-so area etc. The Hilton down the street would be my call. This one might end up a Hotel 6 or Comfort Inn down the road. On the plus side, its close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: fromthere
Reviews.Content: Comfy beds, clean room and bathroom. Very good value. About 30 minutes drive from downtown Chicago. Free parking, and free wi-fi. I feel safe staying there.

Reviews.Title: “1 night to relax”
Reviews.Author: magicspell79
Reviews.Content: I was on an exhauting business trip, 3 cities and only 1 night to relax so the hotel I picked needed to be very good and this hotel was. The positives outweigh the negatives by far. Flew into O'Hare so this hotel is a little far but I flew out of Midway so it worked out perfectly. To start our stay we were given a room on the street side of the hotel, which my colleague (for personal reasons) had a problem with, we asked and they changed us immediately. The free wireless in room and computer access in the lobby was the best. I was able to do some work in my room and also utilize the printers in the lobby to print out my boarding passes for the next days flights. The room was spacious, with silly amenities that I love like a coffee maker, iro and ironing board, robe, toiletries, and bottles water. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in; hotel or personal. THE PRICE WAS GREAT! I thought there would be a free continental breakfast but either there wasn't or we couldn't find it and we wound up eating the buffet at the restaurant which was pretty good anyway. The only real problem I had was the water pressure in the shower was terrible, but I have come to expect that with any hotel I stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel-A good nights sleep...a true gem if using points!”
Reviews.Author: cober6711
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews on here I was a little skeptical of this hotel, even though it was only SPG Category 1 (lowest rewards category), but I was pleasantly surprised! For what I paid (7000 Starpoints for 3 nights) it was a true bargain, considering most hotels downtown require 10000-12000 points PER NIGHT, and I didnt even pay that much for all 3 nights! Room 526, while a little small (although adequate for 1-2 people), was clean, and had a few unexpected features such as a flat-screen TV and even a decent bathrobe! The bathroom was also clean, and while a little on the small side and a bit oddly-shaped it was perfectly adequate. HVAC unit in room was surprisingly quiet. Free internet was decent, but the signal in my room was weak. Didn't try the restaurant, but room service prices seemed to be reasonable. Service at the front desk was hit-or-miss. Some clerks were friendly, some were rather snippy. Yes, it is a little out of the way, but they do have a free shuttle that takes you to Midway airport, and from there you can catch the 'L' to downtown, which didnt take all too long. All in all, its not bad at all! I'd stay here again if I were using points...its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Solid airport hotel w/phenomenal service”
Reviews.Author: peakbagger3
Reviews.Content: Solid clean hotel with great bed and really extraordinary service. Standard hi-quality hotel room at the airport w/free 24 hour shuttle, free wifi, free computer access in the lobby, GREAT beds, and some of the best service I've ever had in any hotel - the staff were ridiculously helpful & friendly. If you get a rate comparable to other hotels, definitely go here. I used Starwood points so don't have a sense of pricing, but the beds & service were really really good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk Staff, large rooms, a bit worn”
Reviews.Author: August11
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on rate and free parking. Cicero was not my 1st choice of town to stay in but this hotel is close to Midway airport and they have a shuttle. The hotel is a bit worn but the rooms are large, internet is free in room and there is a business center and workout room (neither of which we used.) We used the free internet from the room and had no problem connecting or with speed of connection. A/C in the room is a bit of pain as it's a wall unit that makes the room too cold and blows on you but we dealt with it. Amenities in bath were not fancy but adequate. The price we paid for this hotel was quite equitable especially since another major name brand down the street was double our price here. The front desk staff was excellent, especially the day manager. We got an excellent suggestion for dinner from the evening staff, Louie's Chop House. We didn't try the food in the hotel. The area is not the best but it's not dangerous; it's on a busy road and well lit and convenient to shopping. We found the bed too soft for us but the bedding was in excellent condition, as were bath linens. No fridge, but has a coffee maker, iron, hair dryer, which all worked fine. The free shuttle service was nice to have as they give you a ride to bus or train and explain how it works and make recommendations on what type of ride pass you will need/want.

Reviews.Title: “Worse for wear and lack of cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Mastema
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, the staff members were friendly and responsvie. The carpets had massive stains and were not well-vacuumed. The rooms were comfortable, but found pubic hair in the tub and in the soap dish next to the sink. Asked to change rooms, found pubic hair in that tub as well plus trash on top of the TV that I guess the maid did not or could not see. I remember when the name "Sheraton" meant something - not sure if that still holds true based on my latest experiences with this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: unfairtreatment
Reviews.Content: I will never in my life stay at this place again. I've stayed at much nicer looking , more courteous staff, and top of the line hotels that make this hotel look like DIRT!! It was definately not worth an almost $3,000.00 stay.

Reviews.Title: “Certain staff takes away from the nice building”
Reviews.Author: shinagwa
Reviews.Content: Pretty decent stay. Room was clean and roomy, price was affordable. Amenities were nice. Only thing I didn't like was that we had a room on the fourth floor and were carrying shopping bags to and from the elevators. Neighborhood was less that desireable (groups of people hanging out in the parking lot of the adjacent mall all night - some fighting), but at least there were stores nearby for convenience. Staff at the bar was wonderful, front desk staff not so much. The location is on the edge of town, far away from a lot of places we were visitng (i.e. Downtown). But there was a shuttle to the airport (when the driver feels like showing up), which would get you on the El-Train system.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable room. Service needs work”
Reviews.Author: KingsMountaineer
Reviews.Content: My nine year old daughter and I were here for one night on the way to the airport. Pros: Clean room, comfortable beds. Free wireless Cons: LOUD air conditioner that comes on and off all night waking us up. Front desk people sullen, slow and uninterested Messed up room service order Messed up movie order (twice) Lobby looks depressing

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel - but it was a free stay with points”
Reviews.Author: holamexico
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points on a Saturday night prior to a Sunday morning flight out of Midway. We arrived to the hotel around 8pm. We contacted the hotel for shuttle and didn't have a long wait. Upon entering the lobby we noticed that there were people all over the place as a large family reunion was being held. When I say all over the place - I mean people laying on couches, all over the chairs, surfing the internet like they were sitting at home (my concern - what if a traveller would like to check in for their morning flight - We had done that from home). I booked this room using my starwood points - had we paid I would have been very disappointed. Check in: I over heard the young man state that he had "changed our room" - not sure what that meant. Room: We could not get in with the keys issued. The door seemed quite worn. It seemed as though they were not sure what to do about our key situation.. One of the clerks came up and was able to finally get it open. The room was worn - but OK for just one night. Dining/Bar We went to their bar - there was another couple in there and they soon left. We had a couple of beers and then looked at the menu (24 hour dining right next door). Not impressed - may it was the time of our meal (about 9:15) Check out Was fine Shuttle back to airport - we sat there waiting while the driver watched TV. We got to the lobby and were told shuttle would leave at 7am (About 15 minutes). The driver stunned himself when he realized it was 7am. Upon finally getting into the shuttle van the driver needed to tune the radio, adjust his mirrors, adjust his seat....It seemed to take forever. Those seem like things that should have been done prior to us sitting in the van waiting for him to go. OH - and the walls are paper thin. We heard people shouting in the halls until about 1am. And then it started promply at 6am. May have been a better stay without the family reunion.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice with caveats!”
Reviews.Author: KitinIowa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the following reasons: 1. Free Chicago parking 2. Free shuttle to train station at Midway 3. Points per night were 4,000 on Starwood The employees were extremely friendly and cooperative, the shuttle drivers and front desk bent over backwards to give you anything you needed. My basic complaint with the property is that it needs a good makeover. Double beds in two bedded rooms are too small for this man and his wife, "we got little or no sleep". Not that we shouldn't lose at least 100 pounds between the two of us, but I do prefer queen beds in two bedded rooms. The room itself was tidy, but needed updating. Certainly nothing to keep me away from it. The HVAC system was noisy and did not keep the temperature very steady, we spent the night either too hot or too cold -- very little sleep for either of us. The TV didn't work most of the time we were there, we would have moved rooms but weren't in the room enough to bother with that. Two free computers and printers in the lobby to use for guests were very convenient. Parking is free here, so we were able to leave our car and use public transportation to get around town at $9 for a two day transit pass. Shuttle service was near immediate every time we needed it. They gave us a number to call when we were approaching the train station to let them know you needed picked up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: The-Clouds
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for one night and stayed at Four Points. I enjoyed the stay! The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The location was nice... it was near a shopping mall and only about 2 1/2 miles from Midway airport. Check in went well and the staff was nice. I booked the room through Priceline for a rate of $74 (taxes/fees included) I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck Due To Flight Cancellation”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum874
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Chicago and staying at a 4 Pts. downtown (see review). When we arrived at Midway Airport we discovered our flight had been cancelled due to weather. I might add that if the airline would have told us on the phone an hour earlier that our flight was cancelled, we would've never left the downtown area. Anyway, our airline gave us this "distressed traveller" form with a phone number on it. It provided area hotels at a discount. The operator stated that a 4pts. was in the area and was available. Having good luck so far with 4 pts., we decided on this hotel. After making the reservation, we walked outside and the shuttle was standing by for us. The driver was very nice and helpful with our bags. During the drive, he made small talk with us about our weekend. Upon arrival to the hotel, we entered a very small lobby. The desk staff was also very nice and gave us information about the hotel amenities. We then went up to our room. We arrived at the door to our room. It stated "Starwood (something)". Anyway, we thought the room would be of the same quality of the downtown location. The room was large with a king size bed and a couch with a hide away bed. The problem was that the room either was a former "smoking" room or just really musty. The smell was something we just had to get use to being that most of Midway flights were cancelled causing the rooms to fill up. As for cleanliness, we really did not have any complaints. Everything was very clean in the room, just old. Wanting to check out the area, my wife and I decided to go outside and kill some time. We did go over to the mall next door for a while, however Target, Costco, and other businesses were across a very busy street. If you feel daring enough to cross this street at night during a snowstorm, go ahead. My wife and I just returned to the hotel. We went to the 24 hr cafe in the hotel. There was a very limited menu. We ended up just splitting a club sandwich which was actually pretty good. I guess under the circumstances, the hotel wasn't all that bad. The best way that I can describe it would be "tired". Everything just seemed old, outdated. It wasn't on the same level as the 4 pts. downtown. Would I stay there again? No.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: mhkzak
Reviews.Content: Very nice, affordable option for staying in Chicago. Free shuttle to/from MDW and you can catch the Orange line el from there to go downtown. Granted, the downtown Sheratons have the location, but they also cost three or four times as much as this one. Free Internet access (with printers) in lobby for those without laptops. Some reviewers have commented negatively on the neighborhood, but I found nothing wrong with it. The hotel borders a major shopping center. Costco is across the street. Cicero Avenue is lined with new hotels and restaurants. Plenty of options within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable & Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Scott326
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to reserve two (2) rooms at the Four Points â€“ Sheraton Chicago Midway on Tuesday, July 31, 2007 for a family funeral. Those in my party were traveling from Minnesota and Wisconsin and needed a hotel for the evening. I looked into many of the properties around the Midway Airport areaâ€¦where I needed to be (57th & Pulaski) and found the properties either booked OR very expensive for one nightâ€¦between $200 and $259 per night. Not wanting to spend that much, I chose to go online and see what was available nearby. Just going a few extra blocks past the Midway Centre, I was able to locate the Four Points â€“ Sheraton and got two (2) rooms for about $129 each! The two rooms were very clean and comfortable. The lobby was small but nice and the 24-hour restaurant on site, which my family used to have dinner around 10PM that night, was very good and the service friendly. The beds in the rooms were the standard â€œhigh qualityâ€� beds youâ€™d find in most Sheraton hotels. While the neighborhood felt safeâ€¦it certainly was nothing to look at and I would not recommend this property for a family getaway. The size of the bathroom was small but very clean. After reading some of the negative reviews on Trip Advisor, I was concerned with cleanliness of the bathroom and facility, but following our arrival, I did not observe any poor conditions I had read about in previous reviews. One disappointment was the wireless internet which was extremely weak in my roomâ€¦while complimentary to guestsâ€¦I got dropped repeatedly. I felt the rooms were very comfortable for what I was looking for and by driving another mile on Cicero Avenue we saved a great deal of money. I would recommend the Four Points â€“ Sheraton for any business traveler or someone looking for a stay before leaving from Chicago Midway Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us”
Reviews.Author: WindwardSide
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we needed to fly out of Midway. The hotel is not in an elegant neighborhood and our room overlooked a giant paper company warehouse facing east. Our room was clean, small but fine for 2 of us. A big plus was the computer with printer in the lobby. I had no computer with me and needed to print boarding passes 24 hours before our flight. We swam in the pool and it was clean and refreshing on a hot day. The staff was very respectful and friendly and our room service portions were huge. The ice machine on the 5th floor was broken but everything else worked, including the iron. I usually do not use hotel toiletries because of the frangrance but the ones at this hotel were citrus without being too much. Very nice. We drove to the Museum of Science and Industry from here and it took a long time because of street traffic and lack of freeway availability so plan ahead if you need to go downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget option”
Reviews.Author: eebtraveler
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at the Four Points Sheraton Midway after trying for a week unsuccessfully to find an affordable hotel option downtown. We've been to Chicago several times and will be moving to the city soon, so we didn't mind sacrificing a couple of days in the city in exchange for saving serious money (we ended up spending $119/night on a weekend when everything downtown was going for at least $250 or more). The hotel actually exceeded my expectations in terms of staff friendliness and overall room quality. The free shuttle to and from the airport is a HUGE bonus (they'll take you there to catch the El as well). We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at 11 am - they actually already had a room ready for us to check in after being fully booked the night before. All of the staff were pleasant and helpful. There is a decent gym and an outdoor pool if you have kids interested in swimming. Another bonus is that the hotel is right within short walking distance of a large mall and a movie theater, as well as plenty of other stores/shops. The hotel restaurant actually has decent food, and is open 24 hours. The only complaints I have about the experience would be that the free wireless was not strong on all areas of the building (we had to shift in our room to pick up the signal, but we were eventually successful, so I wasn't overly upset). The only other issues were that our tub drained slowly and the room had an under window unit air conditioner, which is just a little annoying because the room does not stay temperature controlled very easily (itâ€™s either on continuously and the room ends up getting pretty cold or you have to turn it completely off). Overall however we had a very pleasant stay and I would recommend this hotel to tourists that are on a budget and have not been able to find affordable options in the city or a business traveler that has business in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice if you want to be close to Midway”
Reviews.Author: eromitlabhitw
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times before, the last time in August 2005. It seems as though things have been spruced up a bit since that last stay. Rooms are clean and comfortable with excellent beds and a couch for lounging about. Bathrooms are nice with good amenities, though I found the flourescent lighting a bit harsh. Internet access is free, the wifi signal is strong and access to it is explained well. There's plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distance, and the hotel restaurant is open 24 hours now. Parking is free, and the shuttle to Midway (airport or the CTA station) is a good option in case you're without a car. Best of all, from what I've seen in online searches, the Four Points is usually cheaper than any of the other Midway-area hotels, even the Sleep Inn in the Midway hotel center. All in all, you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out just fine for me”
Reviews.Author: bartman4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually quite pleasant inside. It was much nicer than I expected based upon some of the reviews. I got a very good rate on the room. It's across the street from a bunch of big box retail stores. If you want a hotel in a nice or convenient neighborhood, I recommend that you consider staying downtown or somewhere near the lake. There area surrounding Midway just isn't that nice in general. On the whole, I've enjoyed my stay here on business and would come back. The waitress on the night shift (I had breakfast at 5 AM) was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Grizzlyman
Reviews.Content: Great location five minutes south of the airport. Large comfortable room with nice amenities. Costco across the street for gas 25cents less than other local stations. Nice lounge with pasta and sliced beef appetizers on a Friday night. Staff courteous and two public computers in the lobby were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with Four Points Midway”
Reviews.Author: LD16
Reviews.Content: No too far from Midway. Non-descript hotel from the outside, but beautiful on the inside. We loved our room - great beds, fantastic feather pillows. They provided a hypoallergenic pillow to a member of our party who is allegic to feathers. Pleasant and fast check-in and check-out. Nice workout facility. We really enjoyed our stay and wished it was for more than 1 night. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ok DO NOT stay here like we did to save money if you are planning a trip to dwntwn chicago. the front desk staff told me #1 it was in a "good area and safe" and it was "20 min" from dwntwn by train. No and no. horrible area and we were afraid for our lives a few times. it is a 45 min subway ride to dwntwn. sooo far. took up half our 2 day trip on the subway. the front desk staff is useless! they barely spoke english and could not answer any questions we had. we needed help finding a church on sunday and they were of no help and gave us wrong directions and we got lost! the day we checked out the guy stood there with a drink in his hand while checking me out! so unprofessional. rooms were nice but not really clean, shower had hair in it. this hotel is not like sheratons I have been at! if you are staying 1 day with a layover at the airport I guess it is ok but dont plan to go dwntwn...45 min with having to change trains and the area is very unsafe!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Charla
Reviews.Content: Had a reservation farther south on Cicero, at the Hilton, but saw this hotel in time to switch over due to its convenient location. As walk-in, I got a $109 walk-in rate - manager told me the rooms are usually $150/nite. I was so tired I could have slept in a spare tire, but this place was really pretty nice. Clean, for sure. Furnishings looked clean and well-maintained. Bed was very comfy. Had a love seat and desk. Clock radio was IMPOSSIBLE to work (no labels on any of the buttons). Bathroom was VERY compact (could barely open and close the door without hiting something) and the shower was one of those water-saver heads, but it got the job done. Luckily, I wasn't decor-shopping on this trip. A nice touch: hotel has two Internet-enabled PCs in the lobby; I love being able to check my email without having to wrangle my laptop! Also, the restaurant is nothing fancy to look at but the food was GREAT! I had a chicken and fresh vegetables with a light white wine sauce that was very, very good and (even!) was garnished beautifully. Came with a "salad bar" that offered several types of past-prime salads including tuna and maccaroni, but I made a decent tossed salad with a very nice balsamic vinagrette. And I got two hot rolls. I think it cost about $15. Tip: Beware the nice-to-me-but-critical-and-caustic-to-his-employees manager. Twice, in conversation with me he made comments that I KNOW would have curled my toes had I been the employee standing next to him instead of the customer. I felt sorry for them.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient to Midway, Restaraunt, Food, Not that Great”
Reviews.Author: Fool for the Beach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on buisness a few days before Thanksgiving. The hotel is in a great location if you are flying in and out of Midway. I was traveling home on Wed before Thanksgiving. Was able to get to the airport, drop off rental car, check in, and get through security within 45 min of walking out of hotel room. Keep in mind this was the busiest travel day of the year. Hotel was clean, they had free wireless internet which was great. The room service was fast, but the food was not that great. I had (3) meals there (1) breakfast and (2) dinners. If I wasn't geting triple Starwood Points for the food bils, I would have eaten at the Olive Garden across the street. The food was much like a Denny's. They did have a very nice workout room with all new equipment. I would stay here again for convienience sake, but never for leisure purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Room so - so... service wow”
Reviews.Author: boyzgranny
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the 4 Points Sheraton near Midway airport on October 8, 2004. We called for the free shuttle and were picked up quickly by an incredible older gentleman, I believe his name was Jeff. He was so very helpful. He showed us on a map where to catch the train into the city. He left a great impression. Our room wasn't so great... mold around the tub and not the cleanest room... but for $80 in Chicago that is bearable. Room service was shortstaffed but Michael was kind and courteous. He recommended the Sunday brunch. It was ok... but the highlight was when Michael seranaded us. What a voice. I would probably stay there again. It's easy to get into the city and their free airport shuttle was great.

Reviews.Title: “below average service from what is normally a wonderful chain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked because we thought hey the people who own the a very lucrative hotel, own this too. How bad could it be. They had 45 minutes worth of problems during our check-in, even though we showed them the our online printed reciept showing promotional rate and proof of purchase. Asked manager to call our room in AM, he did not . Housekeeping did a below average job of cleaning room. some nice things: Computer in lobby. $1 per min but good for finding and printing off driving directions. Also Free Parking. Has a pool, albeit a very very small pool. I would never recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Has seen better days.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is not really a bad place--the rooms are fairly spacious and have a sofa which is nice. There is a mall next door and you can get meals from their food court to save $$. The problem is that the place needs updating. Also, my bathroom had hair all over it (not mine), and there was a fair amount of dust on parts of the furniture. There are about 5 other more modern hotels just a few blocks away--they would probably be a better choice. Still, this is light years better than the truly dreadful Four Points Sheraton O'Hare. This will be my last Four Points Sheraton--they don't offer a consistent, quality product.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a little old compare to the new ones nearby. Room is clean and pretty standard. What surprised us was the good service and a first class restaurant. Lots of airline personels stay here.
